intro: Hamelia xerocarpa, commonly known as the Mexican flame bush, is a deciduous shrub native to Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking red-orange flowers that bloom in the spring and summer. The plant has elliptical, dark green leaves that are opposite in arrangement. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun, making it suitable for xeriscaping. Its ornamental value comes from its vibrant flowers and adaptability to various soil types.
